column7: TA6.62;Waste Reduction - Municipal Waste;+;The restoration of terrestrial ecosystems can lead to increased waste reduction in municipal areas
column8: as restored ecosystems can help absorb and process waste
column9: reducing the need for landfill and incineration. This synergy can be seen in the targets of TA6.11
column10: which aims to plant three billion trees
column12: which aims to reduce the environmental and climate footprint of EU cities.

column4: TA6.48;Circularity/Recycling - Municipal Waste;-;The restoration of agricultural ecosystems can lead to increased waste generation in municipal areas
column5: as the use of organic farming methods and reduction of synthetic fertilizers and pesticides can result in increased waste from agricultural activities. This trade-off can be seen in the targets of TA5.9
column6: which aims to increase organic farming
column8: which aims to have at least 10% of agricultural area under high-diversity landscape features.

column6: TA6.59;Critical Raw Materials - Extraction & Import;+;The restoration of forests can lead to increased availability of critical raw materials
column8: which can reduce the need for extraction and import of these materials. This synergy can be seen in the targets of TA6.11
column9: which aims to plant three billion trees
column11: which aims to strictly protect all remaining EU primary and old-growth forests.

column4: TA6.45;Waste Reduction - Plastic & Packaging;+;The restoration of marine ecosystems can lead to reduced plastic pollution in the ocean
column5: as restored ecosystems can help absorb and process plastic waste. This synergy can be seen in the targets of TA6.2
column6: which aims to legally protect at least 30% of the EU's sea area
column8: which aims to establish effective and sustainable management of marine protected areas.

column9: TA6.62;Circularity/Recycling;-;The protection and conservation of biodiversity can lead to increased costs and complexity in recycling and waste management
column10: as the use of certain materials and practices may harm biodiversity. This trade-off can be seen in the targets of TA5.11
column11: which aims to protect the environment and restore natural habitats
column13: which aims to legally protect at least 30% of the EU's land area.

column4: TA6.28;Waste Reduction - Food Waste;-;The protection and conservation of biodiversity in fisheries can lead to reduced food waste
column5: as sustainable fishing practices can help reduce bycatch and discarding of fish. This synergy can be seen in the targets of TA5.6
column6: which aims to increase sustainable fishing and aquaculture
column8: which aims to eliminate or reduce bycatch of species.

column2: TA6.46;Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling;+;The monitoring of biodiversity can lead to increased efficiency in the recycling of critical raw materials
column3: such as those used in batteries
column4: as monitoring can help identify areas where materials can be recovered and recycled. This synergy can be seen in the targets of TA6.37
column5: which aims to ensure that the condition of ecosystems is maintained or restored
column7: which aims to ensure that the use of resources is sustainable and efficient.

column4: TA6.41;Waste Reduction - Municipal Waste;+;The protection and conservation of urban nature can lead to increased waste reduction in municipal areas
column5: as urban ecosystems can help absorb and process waste
column6: reducing the need for landfill and incineration. This synergy can be seen in the targets of TA6.16
column7: which aims to have cities with at least 20
column8: 000 inhabitants have an urban green infrastructure
column10: which aims to ensure that there is no net loss of urban ecosystems.
